action.action-desc: Mr. Hanna (for himself and Mr. Higgins) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: Condemning the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea for its continuing acts of aggression, its expressed intent to break the July 10, 1953, Korean War Armistice Agreement, and for its repeated violations of United Nations Security Council resolutions.

whereas.text: Whereas on February 12, 2013, a nuclear device was exploded through a nuclear test conducted by North Korea;

Whereas North Korea’s ballistic missile program poses a continuing and increasing threat to the national security, people, and allies of the United States within the Asia Pacific region and around the world;
Whereas North Korea has deliberately and consciously acted in violation of the July 10, 1953, Korean War Armistice Agreement;
Whereas North Korea announced on March 11, 2013, its intention to treat the July 10, 1953, Korean War Armistice Agreement as scrapped completely; and
Whereas North Korea is a flagrant violator of human rights against its people: Now, therefore, be it

paragraph.text: condemns the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea for its—

subparagraph.text: deliberate continued violations of United Nations Security Council resolutions;
February 12, 2013, explosion of a nuclear device; and
threats and acts of provocation that aim to destabilize international security;

paragraph.text: reaffirms the support of the United States to its strategic allies and its support of maintaining goals which promote the peace and international stability shared by the allies of the United States throughout the Asia-Pacific region and beyond; and

supports United Nations Security Council Resolution 2094 (2013), and calls on the United States Government and all responsible nations to apply all sanctions and obligations contained within United Nations Security Council Resolutions 1695 (2006), 1718 (2006), 1874 (2009), 2087 (2013), and 2094 (2013).
